roleset.name: bear seeds, as a plant
roleset.note: SEED-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. No Vncls. (from seed.01-v)

example.name: classic example
example.text: The lettuce seeded before I had more than 1 harvest.
example.arg: before I had more than 1 harvest.

roleset.name: plant seeds (or 'seeds')
roleset.note: SEED-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls butter-9.9, spray-9.7. . (from seed.02-v)
SEEDING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme data. Comparison to seed.02. Seed.02 is a member of VN classes butter-9.9 and spray-9.7. Framed by Katie. (from seeding.01-n)

roles.note: roles may be metaphorical (from seed.02-v) Roles and usages may be metaphorical (from seeding.01-n)

example.name: start-up business frame
example.text: The company seeded the Energy Biosciences Institute at UC Berkeley with $500 million to develop biofuels.
example.arg: the Energy Biosciences Institute at UC Berkeley

example.name: farming frame-- no arg1
example.text: I seeded peas, onions and corn salad today!

example.name: farming frame-- reflexive
example.text: The Sunflowers seeded themselves on top of the mats.

example.name: business frame
example.text: In 2008, the company seeded an initiative that would create an easy-to-access online movie database.
example.arg: an initiative that would create an easy-to-access online movie database.

example.name: weather-change frame
example.text: [An airplane]-1 flew over Massachusetts and *trace*-1 seeded the clouds with super-cooled ice crystals.

example.name: innoculation with microorganisms frame
example.text: We seeded the water with zooplankton and phytoplankton from a local pond.
example.arg: with zooplankton and phytoplankton from a local pond.

example.name: innoculation frame-- theme as subject
example.text: Only 60 bacteria seeded the GI tract.

example.name: medical usage - be careful with the 'farmer' and the 'seeds'

roleset.name: distribute players/teams in sports
roleset.note: SEED-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls classify-29.10. Comparison to "classify". (from seed.03-v)

example.name: passive with destination
example.text: Lane four is traditionally [where]-1 [the fastest swimmer]-2 is seeded *trace*-2 *trace*-1.

example.name: Transitive with groups
example.text: We have decided on *PRO* seeding the teams into two groups of four.

example.name: passive with predicate
example.text: Guilford-1 is seeded *trace*-1 second and will play either Lynchburg or Smith.

roleset.name: remove the seeds from
roleset.note: SEED-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls pit-10.7. Comparison to "pit". (from seed.04-v)

roles.note: arg2, the seeds, has not been attested. Included based on Vncls. (from seed.04-v)

role.descr: fruit that the seeds are being removed from

example.name: with instrument
example.text: A few hours later I seeded the cherries using a partially unbent paper clip.
example.arg: using a partially unbent paper clip.
